chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery with Use of Force

result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph G Cobb was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility. 
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Concurrent with: to other sentences currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes: Per C-31 Joint and several with co-defendant.

If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.
Must have no contact with Elizabeth Adams or the Rice Lake Dairy Queen.   Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.   Must participate in a restorative justice program/conference that may include the victim(s). Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: other sentences being served.

Defendant Joseph G Cobb in court with attorney Chris A. Gramstrup.  Defendant Joseph G Cobb in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

5 years extended supervision concurrent to other cases being served.
